intro: Cyphostemma comorense, commonly known as the Comoros moonvine, is a climbing plant native to the Comoros Islands in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Convulvulaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by edible, fleshy berries. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in coastal areas and secondary forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
